content.prompt: The historical situation of the excerpt supports which of the following arguments about reform in the Gilded Age?

choices.label: The idea of the Social Gospel inspired the development of many new reform movements.
The position of women as prominent leaders in reform movements increased their public role in society.
Reformers encouraged city residents to fight corruption by joining utopian communities.
Reformers advocated expanded college access for immigrants in order to facilitate social integration.
